page.title: 14Yetholm Crop Production
page.content: Crops grown in the area include wheat, barley peas, turnips, and the more recent crop to the area oil seed rape adding a bright yellow in summer to the magnificent patchwork of fields. Oats are grown on Yetholm Mains. The Majority of crops grown are used for feeding the livestock but some is sold on the open market. A market garden at Thirlestane is in the early stages of development concentrating of soft fruits and summer salad crops. Polythene tunnels have been erected and it is hoped to develop a 'Pick Your Own' market garden. Conservation is important to the farmers in the locality. Hedges have been retained and planted along with a small mixed woodland areas. Farm records at Yetholm Mains are now retained in the micro-computer and much wider use of modern technology.
